### Emergency Medical Advice and Telemedicine Support for the Canadian Coast Guard on board vessels

#### Tender Details

| Field | Description |
| --- | --- |

| **Publication Date** | 2024-04-04 |

| **Contract Duration** | 2 Years (from 2024-04-30 to 2026-04-30) |

#### RFP Description

The Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) seeks to provide emergency medical care and telemedicine support to CCG personnel on board vessels during Arctic and scientific voyages in remote areas. The service will be provided by emergency physicians who will offer expert medical advice and reporting services to shipboard health officers.

The objective of the CCG Health Officers program is to reduce medical evacuations by enabling CCG health officers (nurses) to manage patient treatment on board the ship. Telemedicine services will be provided through phone and/or internet, enabling emergency physicians to support CCG health officers in remote locations.

#### Evaluation Criteria

The proposal will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

* Technical merit: Evaluation of the scope of practice and clinical assessment skills of CCG Health Officers (nurses)
* Price: The combined rating of technical merit and price will be used to select the best proposal.

#### Requirements

* The contractor must demonstrate the ability to provide emergency medical advice and telemedicine support to CCG personnel on board vessels in remote areas.
* The contractor must provide a minimum of one health officer (nurse) and one emergency physician to support CCG Health Officers on board.
* The contractor must report the evaluation of the overall quality of care given by CCG Health Officers to the CCG National Coordinator of the Health Officers program every month.
